intro: Tambourissa decaryana, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. The flowers bloom from late winter to early spring, adding ornamental value to the garden.
